news.title: TDR scam: Land owner points fingers at Nagpur city survey officials
news.para: The probe had revealed irregularities by the urban land ceiling (ULC) department, NMC and Nagpur Improvement Trust (NIT) in issuance of transferable development rights (TDR) worth over Rs40 crore to Bharat Patel and Sanjay Avchat.

news.title: Chandigarh adviser seeks report on land pooling policy on April 19
news.para: The administration has already decided to come out with a draft on the policy being prepared by Bengaluru-based Indian Institute of Human Settlement (IIHS).

news.title: Vijayawada: Delay in property tax generation lands new house owners in soup
news.para: The state government brought a CV system instead of an annual rental value system (ARV) in property and vacant land tax calculations.

news.title: RMZ set to acquire large land parcel in Gurugram
news.para: With many under-construction projects, RMZCorp plans to make 5-6 million sq ft operational this year and is also looking at launching at least 15-20 msf by the end of this year, spread across all cities.

news.title: Haryana: DTCP releases draft guidelines on structural safety of buildings
news.para: The changes the government proposes to bring include two layers of independent checks before the occupation certificate (OC) is issued.

news.title: Maharashtra forest department begins demolition of structures inside mangroves
news.para: Additional principal chief conservator of forests (mangrove cell) Virendra Tiwari, said, “It was surprising to see pucca concrete houses built illegally inside the notified mangroves at Kopri.

news.title: Trichy: Construction waste recycling plant to come up at Panjapur
news.para: The plant, proposed under the public-private partnership (PPP) model will collect demolition waste from across the city to produce flooring tiles and pavement blocks.

news.title: Building projects in Navi Mumbai hit a height restriction
news.para: About 150 approved building projects in Navi Mumbai around a 20-km radius from the upcoming airport are in alimbo as the Airports Authority of India (AAI) has restricted their heights to just 55 metres (12-15 floors).

news.title: MahaRERA tells Malad builder to refund Rs 1.5 crore for delay
news.para: The couple had filed a complaint before MahaRERA against Sanket International Ltd (now Rajsanket Realty Ltd) for refund.

news.title: Nevada launches $500 million program to boost affordable housing
news.para: Gov. Steve Sisolak said the "Home Means Nevada" initiative that he and other officials announced Thursday is the beginning of an effort to put housing within financial reach of more people.

news.title: Pune: Nearly 90% of maintenance charges spent on water in NIBM extension
news.para: Most of the existing societies are dependent on tankers for water, while new projects are being launched almost every day in the “fastest growing suburb” of the city.

news.title: On PU's objections, Chandigarh civic body rechecks Rs 22 crore property tax data
news.para: The university had raised queries before the UT administration regarding the tax notice. The UT further asked the civic body to look into the matter.

news.title: SC directs CPCB to conduct surprise inspections at brick kilns in NCR
news.para: The top court directed that those units, located in Uttar Pradesh and Haryana, which have the consent to operate and have also declared the production capacity are permitted to operate subject to certain conditions.

news.title: Rajasthan: People hope to get lease deeds in Shahar camps
news.para: A senior urban development and housing department official said, “Across the state, approximately 30,000 lease deed applications were rejected. Now, the civic bodies will reconsider the proposal and start the regularisation process when camps start again.”

news.title: Chandigarh admin's plan to increase building misuse penalty riles businessmen
news.para: Federation members decided to oppose the notice and termed the 5% annual increase in penalty completely unwarranted since the penalty proposed was already higher and there was no legal basis for increasing it year after year.
